Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; sharp offset on inside; interior: reserved band at topof rim, glazed below; top of rim glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with line between; glaze below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-6) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-8). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. Unlike most South Ionian cups with everted rims, this sherd demonstrates that the cup was unusually large.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 23.1.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.719) (Phase 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 268; p. 109, Nau 66, pl.14c-d)
